DataElement.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination Status
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the status of whether a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study based on the patient having a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting treatment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Surgical Procedure Injury Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study by having had a diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue or damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Used for operative procedures on organs, regions, or tissues in the treatment of diseases, including tissue section by lasers. It excludes transplantation, for which "transplantation" is used.:Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.
Damage inflicted on the body as the direct or indirect result of an external force, with or without disruption of structural continuity.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Satisfying the appropriate conditions for inclusion._A condition or state at a particular time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: That which constitutes a standard from which a judgment can be established, a reference point against which other things can be evaluated, or a basis for comparison.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Participants may not have a m
ReferenceDocuments.description: Participants may not have a major surgical procedure, open biopsy, or significant traumatic injury within 28 days prior to starting sunitinib.
